group.title: Topic A (gr)
group.instructions: When group level = 3, we want to see the Topic A (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. This is the current behavior and what is desired.

page.title: Topic A (PG)
page.instructions: When group level = page, we don't want to see the Topic A (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. The last level of group title, e.g., Topic A (gr), is redundant. To achieve this will necessitate a change in what is displayed.

group.title: Topic B (gr)
group.instructions: When group level = 3, we want to see the Topic B (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. This is the current behavior and what is desired.

page.title: Topic B (pg)
page.instructions: When group level = page, we don't want to see the Topic B (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. The last level of group title, e.g., Topic B (gr), is redundant. To achieve this will necessitate a change in what is displayed.

group.title: Display-when, clone and their interplay check

page.title: Clone with Display_when check

page.title: Display_when - Clone - Display_when-Repeat

page.title: Display_when - Clone - Display_when - Clone Yes-No
page.instructions: Checking the dynamic when a display_when, select_multi option do display_whens and then clone the whole thing from an option to clone

page.title: Checks for CDATA rendering in text-type elements
page.instructions: This check for the DOCX parser (because it is not handling CDATA strings correctly at the moment)

question.title: Question 1.5 Title
question.text: Question 1.5 Text - "cloze"; all fields; bnf json= insert
question.note: Question 1.5 Note: check insert separator in multi-select 1.5.d - {"insert": {"qref": "q.1.5.d"}}
question.instructions: Question 1.5 Instructions

response.text: Question 1.5 response text {"cloze": {"validation": {"max": "5", "invalid_text": "invalid value, must be between 3-5, inclusive", "min": "3"}, "type": "numerical", "id": "q.1.5.a"}} {"cloze": {"validation": {"pattern": "[^\\s]*", "invalid_text": "no spaces"}, "type": "textbox", "id": "q.1.5.b"}} {"cloze": {"default": "option (single) list", "type": "select one", "id": "q.1.5.c", "options": ["option 1", "option 2", "option 3"]}}{"cloze": {"default": "option (multi) list", "validation": {"minlength": "2", "required": "required", "invalid_text": "pick two"}, "type": "select multi", "id": "q.1.5.d", "options": ["option 1", "option 2", "option 3"]}}{"cloze": {"validation": {"required": "required", "invalid_text": "enter something"}, "type": "memo", "id": "q.1.5.e"}}
response.BNF_mapping: BNF for option q.1.5; insert cloze: A(numeral): {"insert": {"qref": "q.1.5.a"}}; B(text): {"insert": {"qref": "q.1.5.b"}}; C(select_one):{"insert": {"qref": "q.1.5.c"}}; D(select_multi with mod):{"insert": {"qref": "q.1.5.d", "separator": ",", "mod" : {"option 3" : "mod\u0027d option 3", "option 2" : "mod\u0027d option 2", "option 1" : "mod\u0027d option 1"}}} E(memo):{"insert": {"qref": "q.1.5.e"}}

question.title: Question 1.7 Title
question.text: Question 1.7 Text - "cloze"; all fields; bnf json= insert
question.note: Question 1.7 Note: Math +3: {"insert":{"qref":"q.1.7.a","math":"3"}}. Check MODs in select_one: {"insert": {"qref":"q.1.7.c","mod":{ "Mary's choice":"1st option - Mary's choice", "John's quandary":"2nd option -- John's quandary", "Ken's dilemma":"3rd option - Ken's dilemma"}}} - - Check MODs in multi-select 1.7.d - {"insert": {"qref": "q.1.7.d","mod":{"option 3": "option C mod", "option 2": "option B mod", "option 1":"option A mod"}}}
question.instructions: Question 1.7 Instructions

response.text: Question 1.7 response text {"cloze": {"validation": {"max": "5", "invalid_text": "invalid value, must be between 3-5, inclusive", "min": "3"}, "type": "numerical", "id": "q.1.7.a"}} {"cloze": {"validation": {"pattern": "[^\\s]*", "invalid_text": "no spaces"}, "type": "textbox", "id": "q.1.7.b"}} {"cloze": {"default": "option (single) list", "type": "select one", "id": "q.1.7.c", "options": ["Mary's choice", "John's quandary", "Ken's dilemma"]}}{"cloze": {"default": "option (multi) list", "validation": {"minlength": "2", "required": "required", "invalid_text": "pick two"}, "type": "select multi", "id": "q.1.7.d", "options": ["option 3", "option 2", "option 1"]}}{"cloze": {"validation": {"required": "required", "invalid_text": "enter something"}, "type": "memo", "id": "q.1.7.e"}}
response.BNF_mapping: BNF for option q.1.7; insert cloze: A(numeral): {"insert": {"qref": "q.1.7.a"}}; B(text): {"insert": {"qref": "q.1.7.b"}}; C(select_one):{"insert": {"qref": "q.1.7.c", "mod":{ "Mary's choice":"1st option - Mary's choice", "John's quandary":"2nd option -- John's quandary", "Ken's dilemma":"3rd option - Ken's dilemma"}}}; D(select_multi):{"insert": {"qref": "q.1.7.d"}} E(memo):{"insert": {"qref": "q.1.7.e"}}

sign_up.name_invalid: Name must be only letters and numbers
sign_up.instructions:
A username must consist of only letters and numbers.
If you forget this username, your account and any saved responses cannot be recovered. Only a scrambled version is ever stored in order to protect your identity.
This application does not use passwords.
sign_up.user_created_text: Your user id can NOT be recovered if you forget or lose it. Please keep it safe.

policies_for_review.preinstructions:
Introduction

About the Application
The Password Policy Formalization application provides a way for users to provide password policy researchers with their interpretation of the rules contained in real-world password policies using a question-answer format.

Because any one policy may contain a variety of rules, the set of questions asked during each policy review covers the entire password policy rule set identified by the research team. Some statements that direct user behavior are advice rather than rules. The statement, "Passwords should be memorable," is a good example of this and the questions do not cover topics such as advice. However, ample opportunity is given throughout the policy review process for users to relate any policy statements they see in the policy being reviewed. More information on rule scope is provided in Help (found in the upper right corner of each page).

The application will present the user with a set of polices to review and will help the user track what has been reviewed. All responses to questions and comments are automatically saved, even partial responses.

Your Role as a User
For each policy that you review, the application will present you with a copy of the policy in one browser window and the questions in another browser window. The language used in the questions and responses has been generalized to represent concepts found in multiple policies. Your task is to match the specific rules in the real world policy with the generalized responses in the question set.

Required Questions
Although none of the questions are required, please select all of the appropriate matches whenever possible to provide a complete representation of the policy's rules. If you are confused or don't think that the available answers are sufficient, then let us know through the optiona comment area provided on each page. There is also a general comment link (top right of each page) for any feedback or comments you may want to provide.
policies_for_review.instructions: Please select a policy from below. An image of the policy will open in a separate window; the questionnaire for this study will be displayed in the this window. Your responses are automatically saved.

questionnaire.invalid_popup_text: Complete responses now? Select 'Fix' to complete your responses. Select 'Move on' to leave this page.
questionnaire.clone_warning_text: The option you just selected will remove all subsequent repeated statements with associated responses. Are you sure you want to remove these?
questionnaire.empty_page_message: Congratulations... you don't have to answer any questions on this page!

help.html:
Help is provided in the form of potential questions that users may ask. Select a link from the Help Topics on This Page to view that topic. To leave a comment concerning help or to request that someone contact you, please use the General Comment function.

Help Topics on This Page

  • Function of Password Policy Formalization application
  • What is a Policy Statement
  • What is my Role as a User
  • In Scope & Out-of-scope topics
  • Supported Browsers
  • Pop-ups and Java script
  • Required Fields and Questions
  • Reporting Issues, Problems, Observations
  • Your UserID
Function of Password Policy Formalization application
NIST will compile participants' responses and use them to determine how users interpret password policy statements. By analyzing the responses of numerous participants, NIST intends to identify policy statement wording that is clear and unambiguous and ones that are not. NIST intends to use the results to develop a password 'grammar' that organizations could use to write clearer password policies. Further, single and combinations of policy statements can then be isolated and analyzed for usability and security characteristics. The result is to provide policy developers with guidelines to reduce user frustration and confusion and improve compliance while improving system security.
What is Policy Statement
Password policy statements typically refer to directions to users about creating, communicating, storing, and changing passwords; as well the consequences of failing to authenticate. There are typically four types of statements that direct the user how to comply with the policy:
  • What the user "must" do
  • What the user "must not" do
  • What the user "should" do
  • What the user "should not" do
Role as a User
When you use the application, you will choose a real-world password policy from the list of policies. Once a policy is selected for review, you will be asked a series of questions about the rules contained in that policy. You should select the responses that closely reflect your understanding of what the policy states. Some questions may not be applicable to the policy you selected, but an response option should be available to indicate that situation.
In-Scope & Out-of-Scope Topics
In-Scope
The scope for this project is password policy statements that pertain to general, non-privileged accounts. As opposed to policy statements regarding a privileged account such as one that would be a system administrator.

Out-of-Scope
This effort is directed towards password policy statements for general user accounts, i.e., non-privileged accounts. There are a number of topics that are out-of-scope for this effort and questions about these topics are not included in the password policy questions. These topics include:
  • Passphrases and SSH keys
  • Password guidelines for administrators, privileged accounts, and super users
  • Vague statements, such as "Passwords should be memorable", are out of scope in this effort. 
Back to Top
Supported Browsers
The application is platform independent and works with the following browsers:
  • Firefox versions 34 and above
  • Chrome version 39.X and above
Please report any technical issues through the General Comment page.

Note that Internet Explorer and Safari do *not* work with the application. Please avoid their use for this application.
Pop-Ups & Java Script
For the application to function correctly, you will need to enable both pop-ups and Java script in your browser. Directions for enabling pop-ups in your selected browser are below:

    Enabling Pop-ups

    Mozilla Firefox
  1. Select the Menu button (upper right hand corner)
  2. Choose options
  3. Select the Content panel
  4. Block pop-up windows check box by checking the box or uncheck to unblock    
    Chrome
  1. In the top right corner of the browser, click the Chrome menu icon
  2. Select Settings
  3. Click show advanced settings (link at the bottom of the page)
  4. Under "Privacy", click the Content settings button 
  5. Under "Pop-ups", select the Allow all sites to show pop-ups or click Manage exceptions 

Back to top

Required Fields and Questions
You are not required to answer any of the questions - there are no required fields.  However, we request you provide answers to each question presented to you if possible. If you are confused or do not think that the available answers are appropriate, then please let us know in the Optional Comment section at the bottom of the question page. We have also provided a general comment link (located at the top right hand corner of the page) for any feedback, comments, or problems.
Reporting Issues, Comments, Observations
If you see any issues, have any observations of, or comments about a policy or policy questions, please use the comment area below the questions to report these issues, observations, or comments. Additionally, if there are insufficient choices for any question or comment, please let us know!

Please use the General Comment option located at the top right hand corner on any page to enter any comments about the application, other observations, or technical issues.
Your UserId
Please keep your UserId safe. If you forget your userid, we cannot recover it for you. We are only allowed to store a scrambled version to preserve your anonymity and protect your identity. Unfortunately, if you cannot remember your UserId, you will need to create a new one for continued use of the application. Since each policy review is associated with an individual UserId, any previous review effort continues to be assoicated with your former UserId and you will lose access to it. Please keep your UserId safe.

demographics_survey.submit_text: Please fill out all the data - to make changes, select 'Go Back', to proceed to the study click OK

completion_page.review_all_completed: All policy review questions have been completed. You may review and edit any responses, including any comments before submission. Please use the 'Go Back' button or the navigation menu to the left to return to the questions.
completion_page.submit_all_completed: You may submit your review of this policy at any time by selecting the 'Submit' button, however, once you submit a review, you will no longer be able to modify your responses.
completion_page.review_need_responses: You have not completed every question in the review. Sections containing incomplete responses are shown in the red font in the left navigation menu. Please use the 'Go Back' button or the left navigation menu to return to the sections that need responses.
completion_page.submit_need_responses: You may submit your review of this policy at any time, however, once submitted you will no longer be able to edit or modify your responses.
